entityPackage

Class LevelModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • entityPackage.LevelModel

  • public class LevelModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all information and behavior for building levels.
    Author:
    Dean Kiourtsis, Tom Finelli

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LevelModel()
      Constructs a default LevelModel.
      LevelModel(LevelState l)
      Constructs a LevelModel using a LevelState object

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelModel

        public LevelModel()
        Constructs a default LevelModel. Initializes the default values for all attributes.

      • LevelModel

        public LevelModel(LevelState l)
        Constructs a LevelModel using a LevelState object
        Parameters:
        l - a level state object, which is extracted from a save file

    • Method Detail

      • saveLevel

        public void saveLevel()
        Saves the LevelModel to a file using a LevelState object.

      • addMove

        public void addMove(int col,
                    int row)
        Adds current ModifyTileMove to the stack of moves, and then does the move. Removes all moves after movePointer from moves array.
        Parameters:
        col - the tile column to perform the move on
        row - the tile row to perform the move on

      • doMove

        public void doMove()
        Does the move at movePointer +1. Does nothing if there are no more moves.

      • undoMove

        public void undoMove()
        Un-does the move at movePointer. Does nothing if there are no more moves to undo.

      • setSelectedTile

        public void setSelectedTile(int x,
                            int y)
        Sets a selected tile from the board. Used to show which tile is being modified. Note that the coordinate system's origin is the top left of the board. Positive x-axis is to the right of the origin. Positive y-axis is below the origin.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the tile to set as the selected tile.
        y - the y coordinate of the tile to set as the selected tile.

      • getSelectedTile

        public Tile getSelectedTile()
        Returns the currently selected tile
        Returns:
        Tile

      • getStarMilestones

        public int[] getStarMilestones()
        Returns the point milestones for the stars
        Returns:
        int[]

      • getMovesAllowed

        public int getMovesAllowed()
        Returns the number of moves allowed in the game
        Returns:
        int

      • getSpecialMovesAllowed

        public int[] getSpecialMovesAllowed()
        Returns the number of special moves allowed in the game
        Returns:
        int[]

      • getTimeAllowed

        public int getTimeAllowed()
        Returns the amount of time allowed in the game. Only affects lightning levels.
        Returns:
        int

      • getMultiplierProbabilities

        public int[] getMultiplierProbabilities()
        Returns the probabilities of the X1, X2, and X3 multipliers. This affects the appearance rate of multipliers in the game.
        Returns:
        int[]

      • getTileProbabilities

        public int[] getTileProbabilities()
        Returns the probabilities of the tiles. This affects the appearance rate of each tile in the game.
        Returns:
        int[]

      • getMode

        public java.lang.String getMode()
        Returns the game mode
        Returns:
        String

      • getBoard

        public Tile[][] getBoard()
        Returns the tiles in the board
        Returns:
